page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING We visited Mrs. Boaitt who lives at The Old School House in Tibberton. As the name suggests the house used to be the village school, but the school has now moved to a new building in the centre of the village. The policy of village primary schools is that if the number of children attending drops below about 16, then the school is in danger of closing with little liklihood of it re-opening. Mrs. Boaitt, her husband and their 3 children have lived here for 7 years. They used to live in Gloucester but moved because they liked the house and they wanted to live in the country. The house itself is 136 years old, detached and built of brick under a slate roof. The house has solid fuel central heating and to cut down on heat loss the roof is insulated.
